Package com.redis.ds.ds_redis.core

Class RedisDoc

java.lang.Object
com.redis.ds.ds_redis.core.RedisDoc
public class RedisDoc extends Object
The RedisDoc class handles Redis database operations centered around DataDoc objects. The Redis operations executed via the Jedis programmatic library. You can instantiate this class from the parent RedisDS class.
Since:
1.0
Author:
Al Cole
See Also:
  • OSS Redis Commands
  • Jedis GitHub site

  • Method Details

    • dataItemToFieldName

      public String dataItemToFieldName(com.redis.foundation.data.DataItem aDataItem)
      Generates a Redis key name based on the features of the DataItem.
      Parameters:
      aDataItem - Data item instance
      Returns:
      Redis key name

    • add

      public void add(com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aDataDoc) throws RedisDSException
      Adds a data document as a hash to the Redis database. The logic automatically handles data items with multiple values and performs encryption on the values if the Data.FEATURE_IS_SECRET is enabled. In addition, if the data document represents a hierarchy, then all child documents will automatically be stored as hashes and linked back to the parent data document.
      Parameters:
      aDataDoc - Data document instance
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure
      See Also:
      • Redis Command
      • Pipelining and Flushing

    • add

      public void add(redis.clients.jedis.Pipeline aPipeline, com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aDataDoc) throws RedisDSException
      Adds a data document as a hash to the Redis database. The logic automatically handles data items with multiple values and performs encryption on the values if the Data.FEATURE_IS_SECRET is enabled. In addition, if the data document represents a hierarchy, then all child documents will automatically be stored as hashes and linked back to the parent data document.
      Parameters:
      aPipeline - Pipeline instance
      aDataDoc - Data document instance
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure
      See Also:
      • Redis Command
      • Pipelining and Flushing

    • mapToDataDoc

      protected Optional<com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc> mapToDataDoc(Map<String,String> aFieldValues)

    • getDoc

      public Optional<com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc> getDoc(String aKeyName) throws RedisDSException
      Returns an optional data document from the Redis database based on the key name.
      Parameters:
      aKeyName - Key name
      Returns:
      Optional data item instance
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure

    • loadDoc

      public void loadDoc(com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aDataDoc) throws RedisDSException
      Loads the data document with fields/values of a Redis database hash. The key name is obtained from Redis.REDIS_FEATURE_KEY_NAME.
      Parameters:
      aDataDoc - Data document instance
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure

    • getDocCount

      public long getDocCount(String aKeyName) throws RedisDSException
      Returns the count of the Redis stream entries stored in the database via the key name. Since stream entries can vary in their definition, data documents are used to store/retrieve them.
      Parameters:
      aKeyName - Key name
      Returns:
      Count of stream entries for key name
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure
      See Also:
      • Redis Commands

    • loadDocs

      public List<com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc> loadDocs(String aKeyName, com.redis.foundation.data.Data.Order anOrder, String aStartId, String anEndId, int aCount) throws RedisDSException
      Loads a list of data documents representing stream entries in the Redis database identified by the key name, starting and ending with parameter ids and limited to the count specified. These entries are loaded in descending order.
      Parameters:
      aKeyName - Key name
      anOrder - Order of the stream load
      aStartId - Starting id (timestamp or meta character)
      anEndId - Ending id (timestamp or meta character)
      aCount - Maximum count of data documents to load
      Returns:
      List of data document instances
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure
      See Also:
      • Redis Commands
      • Redis Stream Tests

    • update

      public void update(com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aDataDoc) throws RedisDSException
      Updates the data document fields/values in the Redis database as hash data structures. The updates are selective and based on whether the data item has the feature Data.FEATURE_IS_UPDATED enabled. However, child data documents are ignored during this operation.
      Parameters:
      aDataDoc - Data document instance
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure
      See Also:
      • Redis Command

    • update

      public void update(com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aDataDoc1, com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aDataDoc2) throws RedisDSException
      Updates the data document fields/values in the Redis database as hash data structures. The updates are based on a comparison of the two data document instance where new fields are added to the hash, updated fields are assigned new values and deleted fields are removed from the hash. Please note that child data documents are ignored during this operation.
      Parameters:
      aDataDoc1 - Data document instance 1 (base)
      aDataDoc2 - Data document instance 2 (changed)
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure
      See Also:
      • Redis Command

    • memoryUsage

      public long memoryUsage(com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aDataDoc) throws RedisDSException
      Queries Redis for the memory usage (in bytes) of the value data structure identified by the data document.
      Parameters:
      aDataDoc - Data document instance
      Returns:
      Memory usage in bytes
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure
      See Also:
      • Redis Command

    • delete

      public void delete(com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aDataDoc) throws RedisDSException
      Deletes the parent data document and any child documents synchronously from the Redis database.
      Parameters:
      aDataDoc - Data document instance
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure
      See Also:
      • Redis Command
